definitions: used to indicate that something is done by only one person, group, or country involved in a situation, without the agreement of others

examples.text: in 1996 the region unilaterally declared independence
would Britain dare to act unilaterally in the face of world opinion?

shortDefinitions: used to indicate that something is done by only one person, group, or country involved in situation, without agreement of others

definitions: in a way that affects only one side of an organ, the body, or another structure

examples.text: TB can involve the pleura unilaterally or bilaterally

shortDefinitions: in way that affects only one side of something
